head.title: World Briefing | Americas: Colombia: National Blackout

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Americas: Colombia: National Blackout

block.p: A blackout hit much of Colombia, trapping commuters in subways and traffic jams and temporarily halting commerce in some of the largest cities. Internet and cellphone services were also interrupted before electricity was partly restored in some regions by late afternoon. Senior government officials quickly ruled out the possibility of an attack on the electrical grid by guerrilla groups, contending that the power collapse was caused by a glitch at a substation in Bogotá.
